ys.succinct.util

Class IntBitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ys.succinct.util.IntBitSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BitSet

    public class IntBitSet
extends Object
implements BitSet
    A mutable bit set that either can have the fixed size or can grow as needed.

    Internally, the bit set is backed by an integer array. During resizing the array grows by using the doubling technique. Therefore, typical scenario is to call toIntArray(int) later to truncate the underlying array to some known optimal size. Attempt to grow the fixed bit set raises a runtime exception.

    Author:
    Yauheni Shahun

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntBitSet()
      Constructs an empty bit set that can be dynamically resized.
      IntBitSet(int size)
      Constructs an empty bit set of the fixed size.
      IntBitSet(int[] vector, int size)
      Constructs a bit set of the fixed size.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Sets the bit at the given position to 1.

      Sets the bit value at the given position.
      void setInt(int blockIndex, int value)
      Sets the bits as the int block at the given position.
      int size()
      Returns the number of bits in the bit set.
      int[] toIntArray(int newSize)
      Returns a copy of the bit array truncated or expanded (padded with 0s) to the given size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntBitSet

        public IntBitSet()
        Constructs an empty bit set that can be dynamically resized.

      • IntBitSet

        public IntBitSet(int size)
        Constructs an empty bit set of the fixed size.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bits that the set can handle
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size is less than or equal to 0

      • IntBitSet

        public IntBitSet(int[] vector,
         int size)
        Constructs a bit set of the fixed size.
        Parameters:
        vector - the existing array representation of the bit set
        size - the number of bits in the set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the size is less than or equal to 0, or the size is greater than the number of bits in the given array

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public boolean get(int index)
        Description copied from interface: BitSet
        Gets the bit value at the given position.
        Specified by:
        get in interface BitSet
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of the bit
        Returns:
        true if the bit is set to 1, or false if it's set to 0

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       boolean value)
        Sets the bit value at the given position. If the bit index is out of bound of the current size, two scenarios are possible:
        • The internal array is resized first if the set is dynamic
        • Runtime exception is raised if the set has the fixed size.
        Specified by:
        set in interface BitSet
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-based index of the bit
        value - the boolean value that indicates 1 if it's true and 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the fixed bit set

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of bits in the bit set. In case of the dynamic set the size is the multiple of the internal array's length and depends on the pattern by what the array grows.
        Specified by:
        size in interface BitSet

      • set

        public void set(int index)
        Sets the bit at the given position to 1.

      • setInt

        public void setInt(int blockIndex,
          int value)
        Sets the bits as the int block at the given position.

        With this method the bit set can be used as a dynamic array of ints.

        Parameters:
        blockIndex - the index in the internal array
        value - the int value as the set of 32 bits.

      • intArray

        public int[] intArray()
        Returns the internal bit array as is.

      • toIntArray

        public int[] toIntArray(int newSize)
        Returns a copy of the bit array truncated or expanded (padded with 0s) to the given size.
        Parameters:
        newSize - the number of bits in the new array
